dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Apple (AAPL) Ascends But Remains Behind Market: Some Facts to Note
News Content: The latest trading session saw Apple (AAPL) ending at $223.83, denoting a +0.53% adjustment from its last day's close. This move lagged the S&P 500's daily gain of 0.61%. Elsewhere, the Dow gained 0.3%, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq added 1.28%.

Shares of the maker of iPhones, iPads and other products witnessed a loss of 13.77% over the previous month, trailing the performance of the Computer and Technology sector with its gain of 1.24% and the S&P 500's gain of 2.08%.

The investment community will be closely monitoring the performance of Apple in its forthcoming earnings report. The company is scheduled to release its earnings on January 30, 2025. The company's earnings per share (EPS) are projected to be $2.36, reflecting an 8.26% increase from the same quarter last year. At the same time, our most recent consensus estimate is projecting a revenue of $124.1 billion, reflecting a 3.78% rise from the equivalent quarter last year.

AAPL's full-year Zacks Consensus Estimates are calling for earnings of $7.43 per share and revenue of $412.79 billion. These results would represent year-over-year changes of +10.07% and +5.56%, respectively.

Investors should also pay attention to any latest changes in analyst estimates for Apple. These recent revisions tend to reflect the evolving nature of short-term business trends. Hence, positive alterations in estimates signify analyst optimism regarding the company's business and profitability.

Empirical research indicates that these revisions in estimates have a direct correlation with impending stock price performance. To exploit this, we've formed the Zacks Rank, a quantitative model that includes these estimate changes and presents a viable rating system.

The Zacks Rank system, which varies between #1 (Strong Buy) and #5 (Strong Sell), carries an impressive track record of exceeding expectations, confirmed by external audits, with stocks at #1 delivering an average annual return of +25% since 1988. Within the past 30 days, our consensus EPS projection remained stagnant. Apple currently has a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold).

Investors should also note Apple's current valuation metrics, including its Forward P/E ratio of 29.97. This signifies a premium in comparison to the average Forward P/E of 12.99 for its industry.

It is also worth noting that AAPL currently has a PEG ratio of 2.18. Comparable to the widely accepted P/E ratio, the PEG ratio also accounts for the company's projected earnings growth. The average PEG ratio for the Computer - Micro Computers industry stood at 1.61 at the close of the market yesterday.

Story Continues

The Computer - Micro Computers industry is part of the Computer and Technology sector. This industry, currently bearing a Zacks Industry Rank of 95, finds itself in the top 38% echelons of all 250+ industries.

The Zacks Industry Rank gauges the strength of our individual industry groups by measuring the average Zacks Rank of the individual stocks within the groups. Our research shows that the top 50% rated industries outperform the bottom half by a factor of 2 to 1.

Make sure to utilize Zacks.com to follow all of these stock-moving metrics, and more, in the coming trading sessions.

Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report

Apple Inc. (AAPL) : Free Stock Analysis Report

To read this article on Zacks.com click here.

Zacks Investment Research

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple Inc. (AAPL) has experienced a slight daily gain of 0.53%, but it has underperformed relative to market indices like the S&P 500 and Nasdaq over the past month, with a 13.77% decline. The upcoming earnings report is crucial, with projected EPS and revenue showing modest growth; however, the lack of changes in analyst estimates suggests stagnation in investor momentum. A Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) implies uncertainty. Given these mixed signals, the probability of a rise is moderate, while the likelihood of a fall is also present due to previous underperformance.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed picture for Apple. While the recent trading session showed a slight gain (+0.53%), it lagged behind the S&P 500 and the tech-heavy Nasdaq. The past month's performance also trails both the Computer and Technology sector and the S&P 500. The upcoming earnings report is a key event to watch. Projected EPS and revenue show YoY growth, which is a positive sign. However, the Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) suggests a neutral outlook. The high forward P/E ratio and PEG ratio indicate that the stock might be overvalued compared to its peers. Considering these factors, there isn't a clear bullish or bearish signal. The stagnation in EPS projection may provide further downward movement.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed picture for Apple's stock. While the company's earnings projections are positive, showing growth in EPS and revenue,  the stock's recent underperformance compared to the market and sector is a concern.  The Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) indicates neutral sentiment from analysts.  The high Forward P/E and PEG ratios suggest the stock is trading at a premium compared to its industry peers. Although the industry ranking is positive, this is not directly indicative of Apple's performance given that it's trading at a premium. The neutral Zacks Rank and valuation metrics temper the optimism from the positive earnings projections. Considering these factors, the probability of a rise is slightly lower than the probability of a fall, although neither is strongly indicated by the news itself.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The analysis of the financial news indicates that Apple Inc. (AAPL) showed a modest gain of 0.53% in the latest trading session, but it underperformed compared to broader market indices like the S&P 500 and Nasdaq. Over the past month, AAPL has declined by 13.77%, significantly underperforming its sector and the S&P 500. The upcoming earnings report on January 30, 2025, is a critical event, with projected EPS growth of 8.26% and revenue growth of 3.78% year-over-year. The Zacks Rank for AAPL is currently #3 (Hold), indicating neutral sentiment, and the Forward P/E and PEG ratios suggest the stock is trading at a premium compared to industry averages. Given the mixed signals—positive earnings projections but high valuation metrics and recent underperformance—the probability of a stock price rise is tempered by these factors.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Apple's stock price rose but lagged behind the market. The company's recent performance has been mixed, with a 0.53% increase in the latest trading session but a 13.77% loss over the previous month. The upcoming earnings report on January 30, 2025, is expected to show an 8.26% increase in EPS and a 3.78% rise in revenue. The stock has a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) and a premium Forward P/E ratio of 29.97. Considering these factors, the news is neutral to slightly positive, but the stock's performance is likely to be influenced more by the earnings report and overall market conditions. Therefore, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article provides a mixed outlook for Apple's stock price. On one hand, the company's earnings per share (EPS) are projected to increase by 8.26% from the same quarter last year, and the full-year Zacks Consensus Estimates are calling for earnings of $7.43 per share and revenue of $412.79 billion, representing year-over-year changes of +10.07% and +5.56%, respectively. On the other hand, the stock has witnessed a loss of 13.77% over the previous month, trailing the performance of the Computer and Technology sector, and the current valuation metrics, including a Forward P/E ratio of 29.97, signify a premium in comparison to the average Forward P/E of 12.99 for its industry. Additionally, the Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) suggests a neutral outlook. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is slightly higher than the probability of it falling due to the positive earnings projections and industry trends, but the stock's recent underperformance and high valuation metrics are causes for concern.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The financial news indicates mixed signals for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On one hand, the company's earnings expectations for Q1 2025 show positive growth projections with expected EPS of $2.36 (+8.26%) and revenue of $124.1B (+3.78%). However, the recent monthly decline of 13.77% and trailing behind broad market gains suggest investor concern. Furthermore, the company’s valuation metrics like high Forward P/E (29.97) and PEG ratio (2.18) point towards overvaluation. Given the Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold), there's no strong momentum but there's also no significant negative pressure unless actual earnings miss estimates.
Round: 1

Additionally, the Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) reflects a neutral sentiment among analysts. Overall, while there are positive signals regarding earnings projections, the mixed performance and premium valuation metrics introduce caution. Therefore, it's reasonable to estimate a slightly higher probability of falling stock prices than rising ones.
